body: What is the term that describes the fast-moving current of hot gas and volcanic matter that is produced as a result of certain explosive eruptions?
The End-Permian extinction was particularly deadly to marine organisms because rising temperatures led to what oceanic condition, in which water has little to no oxygen for fish to breathe?
How many edges does a decagonal pyramid have?
How many two digit values of $n$ exist such that the 5 numbers $n / 2$ , $n / 3$ , $n / 4$ , $n / 5$ , and $n / 6$ are all positive integer values?
The energy required to eject an electron from a neon atom is E. In terms of E, how much energy is released when an electron is added to neon's monovalent cation?

An aqueous solution is prepared containing silver (I) and barium (II) cations, as well as fluoride, chloride, iodide, and sulfate anions. A yellow precipitate forms from the solution. What is the chemical identity of the precipitate?
During which season is the Intertropical Convergence Zone deflected furthest north?
What type of wasting occurs in periglacial areas where freeze-thaw cycles cause expansion in the regolith?
What angiosperm seed structure is analogous to the egg yolk in animals?
The distribution of what class of hormones plays a major role in the response of plants to gravity?
The impossibility of reducing the temperature of any closed system to absolute zero is a consequence of what law?

A cord pulls a box of mass 5 kilograms up a frictionless plane inclined at 30 degrees. If the force from the cord has a magnitude of 25 newtons, what is the magnitude of the box's acceleration, in meters per second squared, parallel to the inclined plane?
What is the term for the minimum amount of fissile material required to sustain a nuclear chain reaction, such that neutrons produced by the reaction will go on to cause further fission events?
What is the term that describes the situation where a model may contain more parameters than can be justified by the data, which can then cause it to fail to reliably predict future observations?
[read carefully] What is the value of $y$ if $x$ percent of $y$ is 6 and $x$ percent of $x$ percent of $y$ is 4?
An isosceles triangle in the plane has an area of 2, and has one vertex at the point $(1,2)$ and one vertex at the point $(-1,2)$. How many potential points can be the third vertex?
Which of the following statements is true about paramagnetism?

choices.W: Paramagnetic substances must have an odd number of electrons
choices.X: Paramagnetic substances are weakly repelled by a magnetic field
choices.Y: Paramagnetic substances have at least one unpaired electron
choices.Z: Paramagnetism transitions to ferromagnetism as temperature increases

answer: Y) Paramagnetic substances have at least one unpaired electron

body: Order the following three compounds by increasing dipole moment: 1) Ammonia; 2) Methanol; 3) Hydrogen bromide.
S-process nuclides are generally formed by the addition of what subatomic particle to smaller nuclides?
Order the following three gases by increasing abundance in the Martian atmosphere: 1) Nitrogen gas; 2) Carbon dioxide; 3) Argon.
What tissue type is characterized by a lack of striation, involuntary contraction, and a presence within the digestive system?
What cellular organelle gives brown fat, a tissue involved in thermogenesis, its distinctive color?
A marble balanced on top of a bowling ball is said to be in which of the following states?
Allison places a conducting wire loop inside a flat uniform magnetic field. Which of the following changes will not cause the flux through the loop to change?

choices.W: Vary the strength of the magnetic field
choices.X: Translate the loop along the direction of the magnetic field
choices.Y: Rotate the loop about an axis perpendicular to the magnetic field

answer: X) Translate the loop along the direction of the magnetic field

body: Carbon dioxide in seawater contributes to ocean acidification because it reacts with water to form what compound?
The weights in each layer of a neural network are most commonly programmed as which mathematical object?
How many ways are there to assign non-negative integers to the values of $a, b,$ and $c$ , such that $a + b + c = 5$ ?
Identify all of the following three trigonometric functions that cannot have a value of 0: 1) Sine; 2) Tangent; 3) Cosecant.
In liquid chromatography, what property of the mobile and stationary phases is controlled to separate the solvent components?
As the external pressure on a liquid decreases, which of the following changes must occur?

choices.W: The liquid's freezing point must increase
choices.X: The liquid's freezing point must decrease
choices.Y: The liquid's boiling point must increase
choices.Z: The liquid's boiling point must decrease

answer: Z) The liquid's boiling point must decrease

body: Tropospheric ozone is produced naturally by what phenomenon?
The energy released by a magnitude 7 earthquake on the moment magnitude scale is roughly how many times larger than that of a magnitude 3 earthquake?
Which of the following families of viruses is responsible for respiratory infections in vertebrates?
Sean performs gel electrophoresis on two sequences of DNA: one that is 20 base pairs long and another that is 80 base pairs long. Which of the following most accurately summarizes his results?

choices.W: The 80 base-pair sequence is downstream of the 20 base-pair sequence
choices.X: The 20 base-pair sequence is downstream of the 80 base-pair sequence
choices.Y: The 20 base-pair sequence is located at the same distance as the 80-base pair sequence
choices.Z: It depends on the concentration of agarose

answer: X) The 20 base-pair sequence is downstream of the 80 base-pair sequence

body: Sean jumps off of a very tall building. Which of the following best describes the graph of his position versus time if there is air resistance directly proportional to his velocity?
A block is pulled over a horizontal plane with a force $F$ that makes an angle of 15 degrees with the horizontal. Which of the following statements is NOT true?

choices.W: The direction of the force pulling the block is opposite to the direction of the force of friction
choices.X: The direction of the force of friction is perpendicular to the direction of the normal force
choices.Y: The direction of the force of friction is perpendicular to the direction of the gravitational force
choices.Z: The direction of the normal force is opposite to the direction of the gravitational force

answer: W) The direction of the force pulling the block is opposite to the direction of the force of friction

body: The Carrington event, which caused auroras as far south as the Caribbean, was caused by what type of astronomical phenomenon occurring on the Sun?

Space debris orbits Earth at about 7 kilometers per second, while a bullet from a handgun travels at around 350 meters per second. If a bullet has a mass of 8 grams, what would be the mass in grams of a piece of space debris with the same kinetic energy as the bullet?
[read carefully] What is the sum of the digits of $N$ , given that $N$ is the sum of the 6 numbers $111, 111 + 11, 111 + 1, 111 + 111 + 11 + 1$ ?
Which of the following describes the point $(-2, 8)$ in the function $y = x^{3} + 6x^{2} - 2x - 12$ ?
Which of the following chemical species has the greatest electronegativity?
Which of the following isotopes contains a doubly-magic nucleus?
Which of the following would conclusively identify an iron meteorite?
Identify all of the following three phenomena that are associated with an increase in rotational speed of a pulsar: 1) Glitch; 2) Accretion; 3) Emission of pulsar wind.
What is the term for a species interaction where one species benefits and the other is neither harmed nor benefitted?
Which of the following conditions would lead to resource partitioning between species?
answer: Z) Sympatric populations with overlapping niches

body: What type of damped harmonic oscillator returns to equilibrium in the shortest amount of time?
In terms of $M$ and $L$ , what is the moment of inertia of a rod with mass $M$ and length $L$ rotating about an axis that is a distance $L / 4$ from its center?
